intro: Gymnocalycium itatiquense, commonly known as the Itatí cactus, is a species native to Argentina. It is a small, globular cactus with a ribbed structure and spiny areoles. The plant produces white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are reduced to spines, and it has a dense covering of white to pale blue hairs. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
